The Paika memorialâ€™s foundation stone was recently laid. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The Barunei Hill is in Assam.
  2. Jagabandhu was the leader of the rebellion.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Barunei Hill is located in Odisha. The foundation stone for the Paika memorial was laid at the base of the Barunei Hill by the President in December. The rebellion was an uprising against the British decision to take away the lands from the Paika people. Statement 2 is correct: The Paika rebellion was led by Bakshi Jagabandhu. Jagabandhu is one of the earliest freedom fighters in India. He led the rebellion during the reign of Mukund Dev II. He held the position of commander- second only to the king.
